output_list.vulnerability: This vulnerability occurs when an integer value exceeds its maximum or minimum limit. It can lead to incorrect results, data corruption, and security vulnerabilities.
output_list.reason: Integer overflow can be exploited in real-world scenarios, such as financial transactions, where large amounts of money are involved. It can also be used for malicious purposes, such as DoS attacks, by causing the system to crash or freeze.

output_list.vulnerability: This vulnerability occurs when the programmer has implemented the logic incorrectly, leading to incorrect results or unexpected behavior.
output_list.reason: Wrong logic can be exploited in various scenarios, such as financial transactions, where the programmer has implemented the logic incorrectly. It can also be used for malicious purposes, such as phishing attacks, by tricking users into providing sensitive information.
